instructions.1: Soak ribs in a large bowl of cold water to drain residual blood, changing water as needed, about 1 hour. Drain.
instructions.2: Mix soy sauce, 4 cloves minced garlic, sesame oil, and pepper together in a bowl. Add sliced radish.
instructions.3: Place ribs in a large pot and cover with water. Add onion half, 2 cloves garlic, and ginger. Bring to a boil, skimming any foam that floats to the top, about 15 minutes. Drain, discarding onion, garlic, and ginger.
instructions.4: Rinse ribs and return to the pot. Cover with fresh water. Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes.
instructions.5: Stir radish mixture into the pot. Cook until flavors combine, about 10 minutes. Add noodles and scallions; cook until noodles are tender, 2 to 4 minutes.
instructions.6: Ladle soup into bowls. Garnish with egg strips and toasted sesame seeds.

questions.question: In Step 3, is the ribs from Step 1 being used?
Is ribs from Step 1 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is ginger from Step 3 still available in Step 4?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 5?
If we skip Step 1, is it still valid to rinse the ribs in Step 4?
Can we stir (Step 5) and ladle (Step 6) at the same time?
